papers.title: Effective RF Deflecting Structures for Bunch Rotation and Deflection
authors: Deflecting RF Structures find now applications for the bunch rotation with the purposes of diagnostic for the longitudinal distribution

emittance exchange and for the luminosity improvements in colliders. Report describes results of R&D program for development of deflectors with minimized level of aberrations in the distribution of deflecting field. Such structures
applied for bunch rotation along transverse axis
as compared to another options. In comparison with classical and widely used deflectors
in 2-6 times higher RF efficiency. Structures can operate both in Traveling Wave (TW) and in Standing Wave (SW) modes. To create long RF cavities for SW operation

combining field stability and high RF efficiency. The problem of stabilization for the plane of deflection is removed due to essentially 3D geometry. The main solutions for such structures development are described and achieved parameters are reported.
